item.title: About Me
item.description: I am currently a Flatiron Research Fellow at the Flatiron Institute in New York City, where I develop dynamical models of neuronal microcircuits and animal behavior. I recently graduated from Georgia Tech with a Ph.D. in physics and an M.S. in mathematics.

item.title: Showcase
item.description:
Talks

  • Heteroclinic Connections as Predictors of Extreme Events in Weakly Turbulent Flow, DFD Seattle 2019. (Slides / Talk)

  • Numerical Methods for Determining the Walk Dimension of Quantum Walks, Emory University 2017.

Publications

  • S. Boettcher, J. Pughe-Sanford (2017). Renormalization of Discrete-Time Quantum Walks with non-Grover Coins. Journal of Statistical Mechanics, 2018(3).

  • J. Pughe-Sanford (2017). Properties of Quantum Walks within Various One Dimensional Media. Honors Thesis.

Unpublished Work

  • J. Pughe-Sanford (2017). Experimentally Validating Bell’s Theorem.

  • J. Pughe-Sanford (2016). Modeling the Lorenz Equation on an Electrical Circuit.
